title: Merkel on Brexit negotiations, EU reform discussion
description:
(29 Sep 2017) German Chancellor Angela Merkel has reiterated that she "very much welcomes" France's call for reforms to the European Union. 
Addressing progress on Brexit talks, she welcome the speech made in Florence by British Prime Minister Theresa May but said ultimately Germany would follow the recommendations of EU chief negotiator, Michel Barnier.
Earlier in the day, EU Commission President, Jean-Claude Juncker said it will take "a miracle" for there to be sufficient progress by then, despite a round of negotiations in Brussels this week that ended with some progress.
EU leaders at their October 19-20 summit have to say whether "sufficient progress" has been achieved on divorce issues with Britain, citizens' rights, the Irish border and a financial settlement, to grant the UK its wish to start talking about a new trade deal with the EU.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/668cba572749a9975d52bab87f5611cc 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork
